Review.Titre: Missing Charging Case; They Offer No Replacement (not even paid)
Review.Contenu: I bought the Soundcore VR P10 in summer on sale and was quite happy with them, but I lost the charging case this week. I got in contact with their support and they told me they do not offer any charging cases for my earpods and now I am forced to buy new ones. But I rather buy from a different company because, then I at least know that they would offer me solutions regarding needed accessoirs etc. I advice you to other brands.

Review.Titre: Dreadful service and a worthless warranty
Review.Contenu: I purchased some soundcore life A1 earbuds from Amazon in March 22. This week (20.11.23) I found the left earbud would not charge, the contact on the earbud had corroded.I contacted Amazon who advised me that the product has a 3 year warranty and I should initially contact Soundcore.I contacted Soundcore, sent a copy of my receipt, a photo of the corroded connection on the earbud. To my amazement Soundcore have refused to accept responsibility and are totally ignoring the 3 year warranty. Luckily Amazon have stepped up and once the earbuds are returned to Amazon they are going to issue a full refund.Hang your head in shame Soundcore.

As promised to soundcore team. Poor service following purchase of a poor product (Liberty 4NC) deserves mention.1. Despite all the options the buds don't fit and tend to fall out of the ear. Similar situation when my wife tried. 2. Customer service is sluggish 12 emails.plus and counting3. Info is misleading, initially informing shipping will be refunded later stating this is not the case. Other than poor quality design, sound has been average at best. Should have stuck to my favourite brand (sony), you get what you pay for.

Review.Titre: Before ordering anything off this crew
Review.Contenu: Peeps before ordering anything off this crew just remember whilst all the ad blurb sounds great... IT'S NOT. Anything defective happens after 3 months you get a secondhand replacement, we are talking earphones here. Soundcore prefer to call them "renewed" & carefully checked...mmm, we all know what they mean. SECONDHAND.My P3's stopped working on one side and were exchanged, 6 months later the exact same fault occurred so I contacted again, this time... awww too late the warranties up, so I'm left with 2 duff sets now.The irritating thing with the P3's is they know there are issues with one side ceasing to work and or not holding charge but still sell the earbuds knowing full well that they can just send out more "renewed" junk then a few months later the problem just comes back and hey ho you're outa warranty. What a way do business.He then offered me 20% off some more thinking I'm stupid enough to buy anything else from Anker.Avoid them and their awful warranty rules. My advice stick to a reliable brand like Samsung or Sony.

Review.Titre: Do not order from soundcore if you…
Review.Contenu: Do not order from soundcore if you expect any kind of customer service! The courier they used left my parcel to be stolen, then trying to report this to them has been a nightmare! They didn’t log calls I made, they didn’t read any of my emails I sent them properly, they do not return calls, they don’t even sound like they know how to do their jobs when talking to them on the phone! They sound confused! I still have not had my issue resolved! Since ordering through their website I have had my card details used in a fraudulent transaction and had to cancel my card! All I want is a refund on the goods! They have deliberately ignored this request and are trying to send a replacement! When I have stated every single time I want a refund. It is beyond frustrating! Do not order from these cowboys!!

What a utter shambles, I ordered a Bluetooth speaker on 16th November and today I tried to call the support line to see where is my purchased product. I have been told by that my product is not in the system and they cannot see it anywhere even though I have confirmation and tracking provided, they did not even know what tracking system provided - I have lost almost £40 and support is quite inept not knowing what system they use to track the product after buying - utter joke - I want my money back!!!

Review.Titre: it is not possible to return anything with this brand!!
Review.Contenu: A bit more than one month ago I ordered a soundcore space one headphones in Rotterdam. Even though I liked the quality I decided to return them as I wanted to buy another one. The return policy at Soundcore does not work at all!! I sent so many emails but all I got standard emails that they send to all customers initially.  30 days to return the product has lapsed for me and I am so frustrated with this service. This is how soundcore  treat their customer unfortunately, ignoring them when they want to return the orders. I made so many purchases from this brand but they disappointed me big time.

Ebay reference daddycoolme, beware when buying soundcore products from this company especially ankerdiect.uk on ebay, they never reply too messages also they try and hold your funds for as long as they can without dispatching your order, ignore fake reviews this company is a company run by companies abroad, also if your product becomes faulty they want nothing to do with the repair side, be warned.

Review.Titre: Customer service is an absolute joke
Review.Contenu: Customer service is an absolute joke! Bought soundcore headphones on 11th July and was told will be delivered in 2-3 days , 8 days later they don't care where my package is and told me I have a contract with evri and not them !!! This is horrendous customer service seems like a SCAM!!

Never purchasing anything from this predatory company ever again.At the time, I purchased some sleeping earbuds. The product died on me within 3 weeks. I started the warranty procedure, and then get told "We can only refund 70% of the price you paid". Excuse me what?You're telling me, I pay nearly 150 euros for cheap, chinese made earbuds, for them to die after three weeks, and then get 70% refund? Ridiculous, predatory company. This review was also posted on their website. Try and find that. It's gone. I truly hope this review here helps protect people from this horrid company.

Review.Titre: I purchased a Soundcore Motion+ speaker…
Review.Contenu: I purchased a Soundcore Motion+ speaker two years ago. I have used it no more than 10 times since then. In fact I have only had to recharge the speaker twice. I recently tried to recharge the speaker and it would no recharge. I tried all the troubleshooting suggestions, have used Anker charging equipment, and the speaker will not recharge. I notified Soundcore with the problem and was given this response:"Thanks for contacting us and letting us know your issue. We are so sorry to know the speaker stopped charging correctly. Based on your description, it seems like the issue is with the deivce.I'm very sorry to say the order you sent us expired its 18-month warranty in Novermber, 2022, so, unfortunately, it is not possible to exchange or refund it. If your defective item might be from a different order made within the past 18 months, please let me know so I can process the warranty claim.Know that we register all defects and evaluate them statistically.  These statistics enable us to identify increased defect rates or concentrated product issues, so thank you for letting us know about this.We sincerely apologize for these circumstances and wish you all the best in the future."So they've admitted the issue is with the device. But what they're really telling me is that we sold you a lemon and you need to suck it. Keep in mind I have used this speaker no more than 10 times and have only recharged it twice. Now I'm left with a $100 paperweight. Not a good value.The response from Anker to my review advised me to contact them about the problem and that they would be willing to help me. I contacted them and they told me they could not help me. I’m still stuck with a $100 paperweight.

Review.Titre: I would never purchase another item
Review.Contenu: I would never purchase another item from soundcore, and definitely recommend that if anybody does then purchase from amazon and not soundcore website. I purchased their life A1 in ear buds from soundcore as they were cheaper on their website. Big mistake, when received and started to use I could not believe how bad the sound quality was, they were so quiet, tinny and with no Bass. I contacted soundcore as I believe they were faulty. They said send them back and pay postage yourself as its not a quality related issue, though it was. If they say nothing wrong with them, then their sound quality is worse than a £1.99 pair down the market.

Bluetooth issues - Haven't been able to connect the device to any other ones. It's akin to sending a faulty cable. Nothing about returns automated, I had to write an email and wait for a postage slip from service team to avoid incurring any charges for "damages" when item is in transit. No response from service team yet.

Horrible customer service. Right earbud stopped working less than 11 months after purchase. They say they have an 18 month warranty, right? WRONG. I sent a copy of my purchase for these earbuds dated July 2022. I called them in June 2023 after 30 days of "trouble shooting" with their customer service. They had the gall to claim it's passed the warranty date and they can't resolve the issue with earbuds. I sent you a photo dude with s/n numbers, full receipt, etc. Clearly a scam warranty.

I was so excited and looked forward to my speaker, but it never came. I tried contacting the delivery company, couldn't get through.I tried contacting Soundcore, they couldnt give me any help as they say they dont know where the parcel is either; I waited anxiously for days, not knowing what was happening, and as I reached out to them again, I was advised to place another order.

Review.Titre: No delivery and horrible answer from customer service
Review.Contenu: Purchased the headphones through the company 5 months ago via Amazon and they still haven't arrived, nor did anyone from Amazon or AnkerDirect gave any reason why, or offered a refund or any other solution.Two weeks ago boyfriend purchased headphones directly from Soundcore online store only to receive a response 2 weeks later that they don't have it in stock and that we should purchase it through Amazon for 20€ surcharge (?!?!). So I'm curious as to weather or not we're going to see any of the two headphone sets ever, not to mention the refund if they are not able to deliver what was purchased.

Review.Titre: Ordered headphones on 26 Nov as present…
Review.Contenu: Ordered headphones on 26 Nov as present for Christmas, still not recieved as stuck in Evri delivery depot since 30 Nov and no idea when they will be delivered. Not strictly Anker/soundcores fault but I will not be ordering again unless they change to a reputable courier.

I bought the Liberty Pro 2 and realised they weren’t a good fit, also it doesn’t connect automatically to my iPhone (like AirPods will do). I contacted the customer service and took me more than a week to get a reply. Even that they state on their website they have a 30 days money back for any reason, they refuse to do it, saying they have trouble with the warehouse address in Australia. They have offered me to keep the product and I could get a 20%, 30% and in the last email 80% refund, but be careful because you won’t get your money back.Definitely not worth the try 👎🏼

Review.Titre: Soundcore wireless VR earbuds went in the trashcan
Review.Contenu: I found soundcore wireless VR earbuds to be worthless and they are in the trashcan right now. * The instructions were so tiny that magnifying glass should come with them.* It took several tries to over a couple of days to finally get them to connect to my phone via Bluetooth.* The fit in my ears was poor and I feel that the earbuds could fall out too easily.* The final clincher was that the sound quality was lousy. The range of sound was only in the highest frequencies - no bass at all.

I recently purchased the Anker Soundcore Sleep A10 earphones after hearing about their advertised "noise blocking" feature. With a new baby in the house, I was desperate for a solution that could help me block out the cries and disturbances so that I could rest for my early morning drives.What I received, however, was a product that could only be described as worse than useless. The Soundcore Sleep A10 earphones are nothing like what is described on the website. Every little external sound is not only audible but seems to be magnified!I even tried different settings and adjustments, hoping that I might have missed something, but to no avail. The simple foam earplugs I had been using previously proved to be much more effective.I feel utterly misled by the claims made by Anker. This product has not only failed to fulfill its basic promise, but it has also added to my frustration during a time when I needed support the most. I cannot in good faith recommend these earphones to anyone looking for a noise-blocking solution.It's back to the drawing board for me, and a lesson learned to be more skeptical of over-hyped products.

Purchased 2 speakers on the 29/06 for my work. To my surprise I was very impressed to know my delivery will arrive within 2 days... HOWEVER, No one was at the address when the parcel was "delivered". I arrived back to the property 03/07 to find NO parcels or ANY "sorry we missed you" cards.I contacted their support portal twice through their "live chat" option and I am yet to receive a response. Their Live chat is just a robot that is useless and provides you with a contact form...Was our items delivered? Please provide proof if they were!!!!If not - Where are they?I will leave this review on any platform I can find! Please someone URGENTLY address this issue

9 months ago I bought a Liberty Air 2 pro, I used it few times when going on holidays and the charger case do not work properly. Soundcore publicises "hassles free 18 months warranty" don't trust that, after almost a week trying to get a label to send my defective product to repair they tried to send me a inferior old small buds as replacement, I said no, as I paid more for the Air2 because it fits me better. Them they said if I do not want their inferior replacement they can do nothing than refund me only with 70% of the value as the product has been with me for 9 months! I ask myself, it is not my right to have my original product repaired or replaced for one similar or of superior quality? Never thought Soundcore could be so unprofessional organisation. Stay away from it!

Review.Titre: I will recommended to keep away from…
Review.Contenu: I will recommended to keep away from this company.Im very disappointed and frustrated with the customer service. They  clearly stated  the company was unwilling to accept any responsibility for the delivery mishap, despite the fact that I did not have the option to choose the delivery company. Review.Titre: Support by AI chat bot ... REALLY???
Review.Contenu: You all know, Soundcore is nothing else than Anker. And while the products often are at least good enough for their price, the great customer support they once had, which was really willing to help, actually helpful and did not just throw copy & paste answers at you like most other »customer supports«, especially of big companies, do.Today, it has reached a new level of fail: my support request was answered by a stupid AI chat bot! :-D I guess, this is »evaolution« since they do not even need to pay someone for the useless copy & paste aanswers anymore. But much more important, it shows their kind of respect for their customers: NONE!Sure, if I am »lucky«, sometimes a »real« answer arrives somewhen; in a week, or two ... a month, but mostly never. On top of that, what can be expected of that is mentioned already above.In the end, you will have to pray that your Anker/Soundcore products never fail, since if you are expecting customer support, not even prayers will help you ...No, that's not dramaturgy; it is really this bad/sad! =(

So I’m the bin they have gone. Great if they actually work. If you have a faulty set then don’t expect any help from the company who don’t seem to care.

Review.Titre: Items not delivered and no refund
Review.Contenu: A very similar experience to the one posted by "DP" on Oct 22nd '22 - in a nutshell: AWFUL!!Ordered some Sport X10 earbuds on 3rd October, but order hadn't arrived after one week. The tracking info stated this with a date of 5th October:We're processing your parcel at our hub· EVRiI contacted Soundcore and they blamed COVID for the delays and said please wait 3 to 5 days more.Once again nothing arrived and I asked for a refund. Now Soundcore said the delivery firm will only issue refunds after 10 days have elapsed after the due delivery date.Then Soundcore said they will issue a full refund if nothing arrives by the 19th....16 days after placing my order. So, the 19th arrived and Soundcore said a full refund will arrive in 3 to 5 days. A full 11 days later....NO REFUND!! Are we blaming COVID again??Will ask my credit card company to take care of this for me.Soundcore...will never shop with this company again!
Love the product, Getting delivered was a headache.

I honestly like Soundcore but I will not be buying their products any more out of principle and will def use Amazon going forward to buy things as they have great customer service, although I don't like them as a company but reliability is a big deal. I ordered a Motion Blur Blue tooth Boom box $150. As I was checking out the system asked if I wanted  use the same billing as mailing. I clicked yes and thought I was good. My fault for not checking the billing address right away but no where on my check out did it show the address their system had pulled from google. Now my item has been shipped to the wrong address and they are unwilling to provide a refund. I even contacted them while it was still in their warehouse and they refused to adjust the address. Use amazon please if you are going to get their products but going forward I will no longer be getting anything from them, an error on their end should be remedied by them, this is god awful customer service. Here is one email:Dear Sean Smith,Thanks for your reply.The warehouse ship the items according to the shipping address from the order details. Besides, due to our policy, if the package is not received due to the wrong address being provided, we are not able to provide a refund or arrange a re-delivery.Below is the latest tracking information for your reference:1. soundcore BeatLight B32 LED Light StripUSPS Tracking Number: 92055903050308000003995832. Expected Delivery on THURSDAY 10 November 2022 by 9:00 pm.2. Motion Boom Plus - BlackUPS Tracking Number: 1ZE356F80337835873. Estimated delivery Today, November 10 by 7:00 P.M.Sorry for all the inconvenience. Have a great day.Second email I received: Dear Sean Smith,So sorry to learn about the address needing to be changed!  Unfortunately, the order is already in the works and it's not possible to change the address or cancel at this time.I wonder if it's possible for you or someone to get it from the address it's being shipped to, or if the package could be forwarded to where you are? Please let us know how it works out for you.

Review.Titre: Great product. Lousy, incompetent courier, hopeless customer services.
Review.Contenu: As it seems to be the same as other reviews; great product, lousy courier. I ordered my Soundcore 3 on the 19th August. The tracking lists it out for delivery 21st August followed by the same for the 22nd with undeliverable added. Several emails with customer services who keep replying that it has been delivered. I reply, yes, to the courier's depot. Read the words at the top stating 'undeliverable.' The address is correct. UPS, DPD and the postman have no problems. Indeed, our postcode applies to only three houses and will usually bring you to our door. (Incidentally, why don't couriers ask someone if they are having difficulties finding an address? We are rural and within in two miles of us, any other house would put them right). Finally, I gave the alternative address of our local butcher in our village for another try. Yesterday, 31st August, I had to drive the three miles to collect my package. I had asked customer services to mark the package for my attention. Did they? Did they heck; not even my name! They did offer me a ten per cent discount on a future purchase but it really is not worth the hassle.

Review.Titre: I paid for an empty package.
Review.Contenu: I paid for an empty package, when i tried reaching out to suport services they only answered once and i m still waiting for their answer because i don t want my money back i want the headphones.

Review.Titre: Don't buy: Works well for a few weeks, already third times
Review.Contenu: First I used a Soundcore Liberty Air 2, what I loved to use, until it worked. Good fit into the ear, medium sound quality and reasonable price. But at one point one of the speaker started to switch off in every 5 minutes, or lost the connection. The service didn't repair that but refunded the money. That's ok! Let buy a a Liberty Air 2 Pro. I can say as an initial point than in case of the Air 2 but the dark clouds came quiet quick. After a few months usage one of the speaker makes beepy sound over 70% volume in case of every Mid and Treble sounds, impossible to use. And the other one makes much lower volume than the other. Okay, back to the service, it has been repaired. I got back and the right speaker volume is around 50% of the left one so when I am listening it seems that it has no sound. I understood that is not a high-end product but seriously, it's something like a cabaret or a Chaplin movie, you could smile on that but in general you would cry.

Can't tell you about the quality of the products but their purchasing process is baffling. I ordered a pair of these on Monday and the payment went through only to refund them and say additional 'Checks' were needed. I only ordered them directly from their website so as to receive a discount however I imagine if I had ordered from Amazon I most likely would have received the item by now.There support team only seems to reply at night in the UK make for a very frustrating process. They have requested a second email address to verify the payment which makes absolutely no sense. It's the most bizarre purchasing process I've ever encountered and given I'd like a pair of headphones sooner rather than later I'll be taking my business else where.It's a shame because anker products are normally very good

Truly shocking customer service.I pre-ordered the Liberty 3 Pro on 12th October, and at the time their website stated all orders would be shipped by the 19th.Well, they've not arrived, the order status has not been updated, and their support emails have gone unanswered (I've sent two emails now with no response.)I spoke to their Live Chat team - they're response was "You'll have to email them", all orders are due to go out sometime after 22nd November for everyone who ordered on the 13th.Except I ordered on the 12th. Review.Titre: No Update on my order in weeks
Review.Contenu: I ordered some wireless earbuds from the Soundcore website late November. They are supposed to be a Christmas present but, even though they have had my money for more than two weeks now, I have not received any update whatsoever. The status still says "processing order" after all this time. At the very least I would have liked there to be an acknowledgement that I already paid and I would also very much like there to be an estimate of when I can expect my order to arrive.I'm not sure what to do at this point.. I need those earbuds for Christmas but it seems that my order is either in a state of limbo or Anker just doesn't care to process their orders in a timely manner. I wouldn't even care about stuff taking a bit longer if they would at least be open about it and let me know but the way things are currently handled is not acceptable. I tried asking for an update through the mail but they don't seem to respond to those so that doesn't get me anywhere either. I might just have to cancel and try to get some other earbuds in time for christmas. My advice for those that are reading; do not order anything from Soundcore by Anker if you need something in a timely manner and care about knowing what's up with your order.

Review.Titre: Fake promisses, no response from technical team and 9 months wasted on an issue that is still yet to be resolved.
Review.Contenu: Horrible customer service.Around the end of August last year, I decided to buy a pair of earbuds, and a pair of "Liberty Air Soundcore 1" were at a discount of 50€ on PCdiga (Portuguese Retailer), so I bought them.After 2 months of using them, the earbuds suddenly stopped working, because the right side earbud was overheating when I put it in the charging case.I had never dropped them and always took care of them. Also, I didn't use them a lot, I only used them around 3-4 days a week, for 4-5 hours a day. I only charged them once per day (and some days I didn't even charge them, they were just kept in the case).So, of course, I emailed the retailer, but they said that they couldn't do anything and that I should contact soundcore, and that's what I did, I emailed soundcore asking for help, and at first, they said that they would be able to resolve my problem, even though I had bought the product from a retailer.Fast forward to 9 months later, 19 emails later, and a lot of waiting for their responses (sometimes they didn't even respond to me and I had to email them back again, after weeks or months), and my problem is still not resolved because soundcore told me (in their last email) they couldn't do anything because I had bought the product from a retailer, something that they assured me wasn't a problem 9 months earlier (and yes, the product is still in the 2-year warranty period).Now I have a pair of earbuds that are malfunctioning and 50 euros wasted.And by the way, they told me 3 times over the course of 9 months that: "A technical team would email me to help me resolve my issue". After I complained 3 different times that they did not email me, they told me that they can't help me.If soundcore decides to email me back and finally help me by resolving the issue (which let me remind you, was not my fault, the product started overheating out of nowhere after only using it for 2 months, this is obviously due to a problem with the product itself) then I would be more than happy to change my review back to a better grading.Extremely disappointed and angry.

Purchased a pair of SoundCore Q30 headphones in December 2021 which have now become unusable as I get a high pitched squealing in one side of the device.Contacted Tech Support who confirmed that the device is most likely defective and as out of warranty, nothing could be done.  They did offer an escalation to Management who also confirmed that they could not extend warranty or replace as this was to ensure equity for all customers.  They did however offer a 20% discount on other devices from the website.Overall, very disappointed particularly as the headphones haven't been overly used, weren't cheap and reviews were positive and I'd be expecting them to last longer than 21 months.
Good products, terrible support.You virtually unable to reach them by phone and their so called live chat really is only useless bot with no possibility to speak with live representative.

Review.Titre: I love Anker products and I have a lot…
Review.Contenu: I love Anker products and I have a lot of items. I did not know the Anker Soundcore Icon Stereo existed and was not aware of their rules for buying. I happened to see the Icon advertised on eBay from a shop. I bought one, brand new, and on delivery one could see it was brand new and unopened. Then I read and found that you need two for stereo sound. So I ordered another and again it arrived very quickly and packed in the same way. The problem arose when I tried to get them to work. They worked individually as expected but I cannot get them to play together. I have had some correspondence with Anker and they asked to see the receipts. I emailed  them  the receipts and said that I know Anker packageing.  They replied “ Please understand that since your product was purchased through good_to_buy1, we do not have your order in our own system, and unfortunately, there is nothing we can do to process a warranty unless an order is placed through us directly.” So do not buy things other than through Anker!

Sadly my Q45 arrived damaged because of the way it was packed. For some reason the usb charging cable was in the case with the headphones and pressed against one of the cushions which punctured it and looks pretty bad. I contacted customer support to get new cushions, but I could only get 10% discount or send it back. Since I do like the headphones and think it's a bit ridiculous to sent it back for a cushion that is replaceable, I asked again but I got the same reply. So I decided to escalate the issue to a manager and answer was the same, 10% discount or send back since they don't have the cushions I was told. To me it's pretty weird the cushions can be bought on the US and UK website, but not EU. Furthermore it's restricted to US and UK citizens, so if you live in EU and need new cushions, you can't get them.So with back against the wall I had to make a choice, send it back for a damaged cushion, a part you replace after a year anyways, or take the discount. I decided to go for the discount and buy cushions on UK website, didn't know then that it's region restricted, found that out with ordering. So now have a damaged cushion on a "new" pair of headphones and can't buy replacement cushions.Pretty weird in my opinion customer service can't help with spare parts and parts are region bound.

Review.Titre: Q30 Misselling - No ANC or EQ in Wired Mode!
Review.Contenu: This review is specifically for the Q30 Life Headphones:I originally rated my review at 5 stars as after downloading the Soundcore App to gain access to the multiple equaliser settings (which you have to do or the sound is flat).  The Equaliser provides loads of presets and this worked a treat - uploading the profile direct to the headphones via Bluetooth.Everything was going fine for a week, and the ANC noise cancelling function worked very well too.1 week later I was shocked and annoyed to find that when I came to use the headphones with the AUX cable supplied on some of my other devices like my PC or my soundbar - the headphones cancel both the equaliser settings and the Noise Cancelling Functions!In other words the headphones revert to a flat horrible sound like you are inside a tin can.  There is nothing you can do about it and the ANC button changes to a pause and play button!This is totally underhanded and what is worse is that Soundcore / Anker make no mention of this on their Amazon product web page.  So they have crippled two of the core and primary functions without telling you prior to purchase.So if you are on an aircraft or have no compatible bluetooth device, you cannot effectively use these headphones as the sound is unbearably poor quality without the equaliser functionality and you can forget any noise cancellation functionality.The fact that Soundcore omitted to  make this fact know to buyers has really ticked me off.  However, if you buy their more expensive Q35 headphones, these functions are miraculously restored...  From research I have done, it seems that early models of the Q30 did have these features enabled with the wired AUX connection, but a firmware update has now disabled it and anyone buying a new pair like I had just done a week ago will already have this later firmware preinstalled so there is nothing you can do.I sent mine back to Amazon on the basis that these were sold not as described.  Soundcore should come clean with their customers and clearly state that the Equaliser and ANC functionality ONLY works if connected via Bluetooth!  Then customers would have an informed choice.I am now looking for another set and will not be purchasing the far more expensive Q35s as I believe this is why they crippled the function to get people to buy the more expensive set that are almost identical in every other way, but do have the both these functions working in wired mode and bluetooth mode.

Review.Titre: A+ customer service, quality have decreased
Review.Contenu: Everything affiliated with Anker used to be top quality; both the product and the customer service.The customer service is still some of the best i have ever experienced. They go above and beyond to make sure you are satisfied and that is so nice.However, the quality of their headphones seem to have gone down. Bought the Liberty 3 pro headset which had several issues (connectivity, sound, weird noises, bad ANC etc.). They were so kind to send me a new pair but this pair also had problems. So many that is seems like a product that is still in beta.They get 3 stars because of their customer service, not the quality of the products.
Liberty Air 2 Pro prevented background noise much better than Liberty 4. That's a shame because the lifepro 4 are 50% more expensive.
The delivery was fast, there was a 2 box, the big one cartoon paper was almost completely damaged. the other box with speaker inside was OK.
Good sound and comfortable to wear (earbuds).However, not able to control volume; serious shortcoming.

I contacted post-sale via WhatsApp. Took 2 days for them to tell me 2 where to get replacement gear. Also, the gear was only available on the German version of the shop. Lastly, there could be all colours of replacement gear available, not only black.

Review.Titre: Wrong item at first but success in the end

So, rather than a speaker, I received an ice scraper for car windows. I contacted Anker and after several messages and long response times from Ankers side they sent me a new package. So, finally, I received the ordered speaker just in time for Christmas.
Your delivery company choice is poor, they had the item at depot for 4 days before it magicly appeared at my door, their tracking was very poor.

Review.Titre: Ear pain is not a reason for 30 days free return
Review.Contenu: When I wanted to return earbuds that were reasoning ear pain,  they asked me for a shipping fee or offered me a discount. Like a free return or the chance to try a different model. While I'm satisfied with Soundcore's sound quality, from now on I'll prefer to buy elsewhere with free returns.

Review.Titre: Superb at launch for £80, 2 weeks later for £60...Oh Anker.
Review.Contenu: 'Superb for £80 quid I thought!' for a Brand New Product that only shipped in the UK on 15th November. Then they had a 25% off 'flash sale' less than a week later, which is now a permanent '£20 quid off' voucher. For a new product, I was miffed. 25% off. I'll never buy new product from Anker. I'll just wait a few weeks for a massive sale.Q30 Headphones are spot on, Noise cancelling works fine in all 3 modes, connected immediately, any Bass/Mid/Treble issues can be tuned well enough with the Equalizer app, and were I reviewing JUST the Q30's for £60, they would be a solid 4.5/5.EDIT: Soundcore replied saying the voucher was from Amazon, though I bought directly from their UK store  - uk.soundcore.com -  which now has a permanent £20 off Voucher on the site and no mention of Amazon.

Review.Titre: Great sound but disappointed with the…
Review.Contenu: Great sound but disappointed with the battery life for the budd only get 5-5.5 hours and the docking station, but as I say the sound quality is great.
I ordered the Motion Boom. A well made and solid speaker with a reasonable  sound. A littlebit pricy for its performance.
Good sound quality for the price,despite having 4 microphones call quality is very poor in noisy environments not very good as they claim.

Review.Titre: Bankrupt after charges to send the product back!
Review.Contenu: For some reason it took longer than normal for the product to arrive, despite it was on stock and it was dispatched by Amazon (even though I order from Soundcore's website directly). I live in Linz (Austria) and normally an order from Amazon takes 3-4 days to deliver, from Soundcore's website it took 8 days. I was looking forward so much to get the product and when I received it, I figured out I had ordered the previous generation (Liberty Air). I thought they had sent the wrong product but I realised I made the mistake of ordering the wrong one. Unfortunately, when I filled the returning form I got to know I would need to pay for the shipment back, since it was my mistake. I got a little upset but accepted it, thinking it would cost me the normal 4-5 euros that most of companies charge for shipment. Shockingly, it costed me 14 Euros!! I paid 70 Euros for the earphones and just to send back I needed to pay 14!! At the end of the day, I was heavily penalised by my mistake, even though in present times most companies don't charge for returning items. Finally, because of this I am not going to order the Liberty Air 2 anymore, unfortunately. If I didn't need to pay this absurd in the shipment return, I would have placed a new order for the correct product. Bad for me, bad for Soundcore, nobody is happy. Good job!

Review.Titre: Definitely worth a shot at the right price!
Review.Contenu: The delivery was fast and the headphones sound good. You do have to experiment with the various EQ settings to get the right sound for different types of music. Also, the sound is only loud and clear enough with noise cancellation activated.

Review.Titre: 4.9* q 35s had over a month now
Review.Contenu: 4.9* q 35s had over a month now,  clearly notice the improvement from q30s, to be honest wowwwzzzzz!!!! amazing sound, super loud, personal equaliser 👌 naughty!! Battery life…incredibleWater test,, u get these bad boys wet ur buying me new ones!Price bargain! Won’t get this kinda quality for the price!

Really good price/quality ratio. The sound is really crisp and clear, the bass is there but not that resonating or strong (comes down to preference, I like it this way). The app is amazing, the vast selection of equalizers and also a custom option is great. The noise cancelling is ok, slightly worse than what Space A40 has, but considering it's also cheaper than A40, it's not really a negative. The only thing I think is a pity is that there is no HearID support for these earbuds, so no customization for your hearing. The only reason why I give them 4/5*, otherwise they are perfect.

Review.Titre: Fantastic sound and features at reasonable prices
Review.Contenu: Anker produce excellent-sounding products under the Soundcore brand at very reasonable prices. The new Liberty 4 earbuds are the equal of Apple AirPods in every way but at half the price.

Review.Titre: Good sound but the App needs work
Review.Contenu: Good sound, but the noise cancelling is not as good as other brands in my opinion. It would be nice if the Soundcore App also allowed connection to multiple devices (Like the big competition do!). However for the money, good overall!

Review.Titre: Good shopping experience. Go for it
Review.Contenu: Overall my shopping experience on the website was pretty good. I ordered a pair of headphones, which to honest I didn't like that much. This was my first time bad experience with soundcore, however, the company made all the efforts to make it right, and refunded my money as soon as I raised a refund request. Quite satisfied with the purchase in general.

Review.Titre: The connecting to device sound is very…
Review.Contenu: The connecting to device sound is very loud and hurting my ears. There is no way turn those “maintenance” sounds off. When connected to a PC the sound has some crackling at times. Otherwise, sounds good if listening to music on an iphone.

Review.Titre: I've been aware of Anker since i was…

Edit:Thank you SoundCore to rectify the delivery issue. A new item was sent out with super fast delivery (different courier, interestingly). Well done making it happen before Christmas. Haven't tested the product yet, but good job. Original review:Still haven't received the parcel, 3 weeks late as I write this (through Evri). Contacted Soundcore customer care which said they'd raise it with the courier (parcel clearly trackable as not delivered or lost)I think they should have sent me a new unit and attempted to recover the lost one for themselves. Especially since I ordered it in early Nov as Christmas present and I still dont have it. Happy to change the Trust pilot score if the item arrives in time for Christmas.

Review.Titre: Sound OK just with custom EQ
Review.Contenu: Sound OK just with custom EQ. I bought 2 motion + speakers for stereo experience. It is amazing effect.In case of using in pair mode (stereo) the sound drop 2-3 seconds even if use aux cable or bluetooth connection (TV / phone / laptop) in fw 45.49. From reviews until now this it is a issue of this last firmware vs previously fw: 39.39. I don't found to make downgrade to 39.39 the both my motion + speakers. Maybe you can help me to find a solution for drop sound from time to time in case the speakers are use in pair (stereo) mode.Thanks.

Review.Titre: Issues rectified after a little delay

Contacted CS again to request option of alternative glasses, reply stated this is not possible as refund process had started I requested for option to repurchase at the black Friday deal but have not heard anything back so if I now want this option I will need to pay double what the black Friday price was.

Review.Titre: Liberty P2 good value for money
Review.Contenu: I bought the P2 as a replacement for my P3s which had an accident. (Well one of them did.) Compared to the p3s, the P2 are a bit chunkier. Less appealing visually as they are larger, but also less comfortable.On the plus side, I'm happy with the sound and I prefer having actual buttons than the touch commands which on the p3s are not responsive at all.Overall I'd say the P2 are good value for money, I wish they were smaller (and worked with the soundcore app)
Soundcore doing good job in audio industry, providing value for money products.

The charger is quite big compare to other wireless headphones of similar price. Though the headphones itself not protruding from the ears and they snuggle fit nicely.  Overall I am satisfied.

I’d actually love this problem to be fixed somehow, sending it back or something? Only problem is I don’t know how long that would take and it’s really hard to live without any over ear music.

It goes from medium power left to low but keeps repeating the signal every 30 seconds so you can't effectively use them without recharging, also when being charged they turn off.

Fast delivery, and good surprise about the quality of product. The sound is correct for the size of the device, but remarks are: 1- the sensation of box vibration in the low frequencies is to ameliorate, for example on "the weekend" performer (starboy), necessary to apply equalisation as "W" signature, or presets as équilibre, signature at least for a better experience ,2 -power level 16watts too short. Not sufficient in certain cases for room bigger than10 m2 or outdoor.So, soundcore 3 is a very good choice for price/audio/quality , and I recommend! I am waiting for the version 4 😊

Unlike other people reviewing 'smart' glasses, I did not expect or intend these to replace regular ear buds, but to serve as good sunglasses with added functionality, and these therefore for the purpose.

Review.Titre: Some teething problems, but all in all a positive outcome

Even after a full day of charging they'd only connect to let me know that battery is at 10% and then disconnect automatically. I’ve tried every tip I can find online, but to no avail. Thoroughly dissatisfied as they are now of no use to me, and I've had to repurchase wired earphones! Only positives were the purchasing process and efficient delivery.**Update**The team contacted me and provided excellent customer service. Thank you!

Review.Titre: As high quality and full of bass as…

This hasn't affected other bluetooth speakers (eg. YOYO (S) Cambridge) that I have. Other than that, the sound and build quality, waterproofness and battery life are great.

I have had a soundcore motion plus for a few weeks now and I am very impressed with it. I personally find the noise cancelling has a slight his when switched on, and find the ear cups block out most sound anyway, so have it turned off. Other than that, the sound quality is pretty good for my needs (Spotify, Netflix etc.) and has a reasonable volume range, which goes plenty load enough for me.

Decent sound and charging.In common with this type of bud, a little difficult to get used to insertion into ear to get proper bass effect.Would benefit with stronger documentation on choice of size of rubber inserts that are appropriate, and orientation of bud in ear.

I find it very useful for calls. Handy tool for people working from home or on the go. Battery life is good. I normally use only one piece for calls for better situational awareness and effectively doubling the call time if needed. Music enthusiasts won’t recommend this due to lack of bass but not bad for casual listening. Design is sleek. There are some extra rubber caps in the box to fit different size ears. QuickStart guide is simple and easy to use and provides instructions for commonly used features like skipping a song etc.Happy with quality and price.

Liberty Air 2.Sound is very good. Setting up with Bluetooth required several resets of my phone, the app is meh and operating the ‘touches’ is error prone and difficult. These headphones are NOT noise cancelling. Disappointing for Soundcore.

Premium Call Quality seems false but it might just be my mobile network/ my location in the city that's hampering the call quality. Otherwise, music playback is really nice, I'm a basshead and these deliver good bass, so long as you're not completely blocking your ears with them, I always need the left bud slightly loose in my left ear if I want the best bass response out of them.I haven't tried many different buds to compare these to so I don't have any insights to the quality of the mids and highs. Get them on a sale like I did (think they were £56 on the website) and you shouldn't be disappointed.

Over all they are great. Iver been being them for everyday use as well as in recording situations and found both to work nice. Review.Titre: I ordered from Czech Republic and…
Review.Contenu: I ordered from Czech Republic and delivery time was 3 business days to my hands. Very satisfied. Communication of service line is quick. I was communicating with service line via WhatsApp, because I had some questions about how to turn off my headphones If I don't want to put them back to the case, because they are immediately recharged then. Their response was very kind and quick.

I've sent them a question about the new Q45 about the discount (how long it would be there) as I wasn't able to afford it at the time. They said they couldn't tell me but sent me an exclusive 10% discount for when I could afford this. Really generous guys they are! When I could afford this on black Friday I was still allowed to add the discount. This is certainly the deal of a lifetime and I thank them whole heartedly for it! The Q45 in question is an amazing product for the cost. Certainly worth taking a look at!

great sound,great battery life,one of few with good ip rating.and they stay like a rock in my ear due the good hooks..but probably not good for very big ears...iam very happy....already to plan to buy new liberty pro 4 since i bought these only for most workouts...need audiophile earbuds also ...

Review.Titre: The mini 3 is good however my so called…
Review.Contenu: The mini 3 is good however my so called LG Smart Tv is not so smart and you cannot sync the tv to the speakers.This results in the lips moving but the sound follows a few seconds later and makes tv viewing imposible. I have had to revert to a single Mini 2 unit which brings the souns nearer my chair to avoid looking for the remote control especially when a film with music blasts out and then is hard to hear when the actors etc are speaking.I no doubt will fins another use for my 2 Mini 3 speakers.

Review.Titre: Liberty 3 pro do not sound great out…
Review.Contenu: Liberty 3 pro do not sound great out the box, but then I have hearing loss due to my age. I fine tuned the EQ and wow! Incredible sound, especially on Tidal. They are comfortable to wear as well. My main negative feedback is the battery life, it is just not good enough.

Review.Titre: Simple and easy to follow link up.
Review.Contenu: Simple and easy to follow link up instructions. Excellent sound, I can now follow my favourite radio programmes anywhere in my house.Clear sound. Only one slight downside : the marking of buttons which should be painted white against the black cover, as I have sometimes pressed the wrong button.

I love these headphones. I find the audio quality for listening to music fantastic and also use them for studying for a qualification that I'm working towards - so the noise cancelling feature is perfect for when I'm trying to concentrate and need to block out what is going on around me.I also found these were a really comfortable fit - usually I find things that fit on my head too bulky, large or heavy. These feel comfortable for long periods.

Very good products, that seem to have huge pros and little cons. We are not far with every new product to reach something superior to any model far more expensive. The sound is often great, the soft is amazing, even if it disconnects sometimes, microphone depends on the models, anc is pretty good.But where Soundcore outshines everything is with their aftersales service. I am very surprised at reading some of the reviews here. I've been quite picky with them, sending back the device several times because of little kinks or defects, and they have been nothing but exceptional. They replaced then upgraded my device, were always there, replying fast, even when I would take 3 weeks to do so. I can't recommend them enough.

Review.Titre: If 10 stars existed as a score, they’d get it!!
Review.Contenu: I wish I could give this product and company 10 stars!!My initial delivery had a slight issue (through no one’s fault) and when I contacted customer service, I not only received a replacement without difficulty but also a follow up email to check all was well. So thoughtful in the modern age!The headphones themselves are fantastic! I’ve tried Apple, Bose and various others and I will never turn back from Soundcore now.Fantastic company!

I already was a Soundcore 1 user and had a great experience with that version but the Soundcore 3 is a serious step up. The bass makes the music sound richer and the app allows you to set up your own EQ profile if you want to. Definitely recommend this product!

Second pair, as original pair earpieces are showing splits, but still work perfectly after a year. Wear these everyday, all day to watch TV and game etc, so am really hard on them. These never disappoint me, unlike others in the same price bracket. Noise Cancelling at this price is amazing. Replacement earpieces would be a good idea in the future.

Review.Titre: Excellent sound quality, unbelievable surrounding noise cancellation
Review.Contenu: I highly recommend this purchase! The product comes in a special semi-hard case, its material & construction are quite above average and the quality of sound -combined with not expected noise cancellation- very impressive. Perfect price-quality ratio!

Review.Titre: Before i talk about the product
Review.Contenu: Before i talk about the product , i really wanna appreciate the response of your customers service.I was struggled with the delivery in some point and the way they resolve the problem was much commendable.Then when it comes Q45 i would say that a class with mass stuff though.i fell in love with the headphone from the first sight and rest in head quite comfortably.enjoyed the way how she sounds in my ears and significantly the app and its customizations is simply awesome sound-core signature bass up is my fev till now.It was one of my happy purchases and highly recommended.Lokking forward for your upcoming products

Review.Titre: No problems with the 2 x Soundcore…
Review.Contenu: No problems with the 2 x Soundcore Mini3 I purchased. sadly my LG Smart Tv is not so smart and does not have the ability to synchronise with the Soundcore Speakers. The lip movement on the tv is seconds in front of the sound from the speakers and makes watching TV impossible.I ahve switched back to a single Mini 2 which brings the sound to be nearer my chair and reduce the need to look for the remote when sound volumes ( especially music) blares out from the TV followed by speech that I cannot hear !

I already have the headphones Q30 and bought the speaker motion boom plus, it's just insane regarding sound quality, for me it's the best value speaker compared to all others, u can even compare it with JBL boom box 3 which is 3 time the price.

Very good quality headphones at a very reasonable price. I've got two sets of their headphone, over ear and in ear. Both have a great sound quality. I also love the soundcore app and find it easy to navigate. Wonderful. Keep it up Soundcore.

Review.Titre: The headphones really have a very good…
Review.Contenu: The headphones really have a very good sound. The sound settings are very extensive. The real reason for purchase was the pulse measurement function. Here the app has a little catching up to do. The functions are only rudimentary and, for example, have no connection to Apple Health or other Sport apps.

Excellent quality. I have a life P2, A30i and space 40 which I use for work and gym. Excellent sound, noise cancelling in A30i and Space 40 is really good. Stays in your ears even working out vigorously. I washed my p2 in my pockets and it is back to life after a few days of drying. I wouldn't pay for Apple or Samsung earbuds. Just my personal experience

So, review after 4 months. I love this company. I made a mistake and ordered headphones in blue color, after fast (1 day respond time) exchange of emails it wasn't any problem to change the color of headphones and they sent me the ones I wanted (without any backlogs). Which is something I have never experienced before. So I am happy with the Soundcore support.

I love this Sport X10. Sounds good, I dont think its too bassy as they say in reviews. It fits perfectly in my ears, the button is easy to find and push. Rotating the hook is a good idea, it allows a smaller charging case, but I needed some time to get used to it, especially to which direction I should rotate it but I think its worth it for the smaller case. I like the nosie reduction function, it doesnt eliminate every noise but I dont like to eliminate all external sounds anyway, however when its windy or there is some other outside noise, it does it job, I can hear what I listen to. The connection is very stable and has the maximum range that my phone allows, comparing the connection to that previously owned earbuds had, this is the best I have so far.

It was overall good experience, from online purchase to unboxing and first listening. Package is well designed, product offers wide range of fitment options. Sound quality is really good for this price range, and ANC also. Would definitely recommend!
Great products,  the best on the market for the price. They have amazing costumer service.  All their products is covered by manufacturer warranty.  Would definitely recommend them.

Review.Titre: Best budget friendly yet still high quality headphone
Review.Contenu: I wanted a budget friendly headphone with noise cancelling, and after some research and YouTube reviews i came across Soundcore, to be honest i am very surprised about the quality of the headphones.- optic and feel: the optic is simple and chic, i like the button design too, and the cushion material feels so soft and easy on your ears.- battery life: amazing battery life, i haven’t charged it yet since i got it 2 weeks ago, and i always had ANC on.- sound quality: some ppl say the bass is too heavy but tbh i like it, and you can configure that in the app, which is awesome. Plus it gives you 3 different ANC modes.I am very happy with the purchase, if you are looking for a budget friendly but still very good noise-canceling headphone, def consider Soundcore.

Motion Boom Plus is great product. The sound is unbelievable. Sound signature is very similar to the JBL boombox 3 as owed one recently. The difference being that this product costs half the price! Amazing customer service from the company.

Review.Titre: I have B&W Px7s and Sony wh1000xm4s and…
Review.Contenu: I have B&W Px7s and Sony wh1000xm4s and bought the soundcores for work... I was surprised that the Space Q45s can hang with the other two without any problem at all for one 3rd of the price... well done guys keep it up

After my trustworthy pair of earbuds gave up after a good few years of use, I purchased the Soundcore Life A1 a few months ago. Recently the left earbud started to malfunction so I contacted customer support via email, as they were still under warranty and I am pleased to say that I have received the best customer service in a long time. Not only they were quick to respond, they even CHASED me, to understand if the problem had been solved and to understand if the replacement was to my standard. I a still flabbergasted

Review.Titre: Ok as a Tech reviewer I've been a very…
Review.Contenu: Ok as a Tech reviewer I've been a very proud owner of Ankers most excellent portable Bluetooth speaker which is the Soundcore Motion BoomThis speaker I've owned for over 2 years and I use on a daily basis, and the battery still gives me over 20hrs of playtime and it still sounds as good as the 1st day I got it.Before the Soundcore Motion Boom I owned the Anker Soundcore Boost (over 3 years old) and even this speaker is still very useable and I have no complaints... And moving along to Ankers Bluetooth headphones I own the Soundcore Life A2 NC,and again battery life and sound quality are still as good as I first bought them 2 years agoSo if you want to find out more regarding the above Anker Soundcore BT speakers & earbuds then watch my Tech channel @lets-talk-tech-uk as I've got some content of these (and possibly more) being aired very soon .. so don't forget to Subscribe so you don't miss out on the latest Technology and if it's good it's good and if it's bad then I'll let you know

Review.Titre: I'm a big fan of soundcore products!
Review.Contenu: I'm a big fan of soundcore products! I love the sound and the flexibility that the app gives us in terms of personalization. Very pleased with my Liberty 4's. The only thing I would like to be better is the transparency mode, that has a lot of white noise and is louder than the real noise around you. A bit like if you were wearing a earing aid device. If I put them on at the gym, with loud music around, it is a bit stressful to my ears... must turn of transparency before the gym! Other than that, nothing else to complaint about. Very nice and detailed sound, comfortable to wear, good battery life and for me a very good overall product and better than others, much more expensive.

Brilliant, so impressed with how much bass these have but also how good they sound. I only went for these as I wanted heavy bass in ear buds and read reviews which led me to these and I’m so pleased I did.

After informing them about the problem with battery of my liberty 3 pro, they responded quickly and within 3-4 emails they informed me of replacement part being shipped and I received it within 2 day. Support was quick and very helpful without giving me any headaches. Buds themselves are great for their price and as someone who uses AirPods pro and liberty on daily base for over a year, I will pick soundcore any time of the day. Better noise cancelling, way better microphone and call quality, surprisingly better connection stability with apple watch than AirPods, better ear placement and tighter grip for using during workouts.

Review.Titre: …5 star to sound and value for money
Review.Contenu: Ready connection to bluetooth to all my devices sound quality overall very please.Very good balance to quality and value for money.Would like the control buttons more conspicous to the eye.ie in colour to black background and more bolder in size.

Review.Titre: Delivered on time and great quality
Review.Contenu: I ordered around holidays holidays and while it took a longer time to ship them they still arrived on time (even day before scheduled time).I always liked other Anker products and the headphones I ordered are no different. Great value for price.

I’ve got several Soundcore and Anker products because I have read good reviews about them and have to say I have not been disappointed with their quality and performance.Until now I have enjoyed the products and recently replaced other company’s broken earbuds with A40 earbuds,  Travelling to work and using another earbud was good but difficult to make out dialogue but the A40 earbuds noise cancelling feature was so successful and being able to tune them to my own hearing was great. I would really recommend them.Where Anker really shone was when a fault developed in the left earbud. I contacted Anker customer service, checked a few things and had a replacement pair within 4 days. I was expecting them in 10-14 days. Under promising and over delivering, that what I call great customer service. Praise when praise is due.Thanks for your great service and great products.Michael Mckee

Review.Titre: I have your earbuds, headphones and speakers
Review.Contenu: I have your earbuds, headphone and a speaker - excellent sound, long lasting battery and great sound cancelation. And I bought your speakers for two of my friends and they are very satisfied.

Review.Titre: You can get to know a company better…
Review.Contenu: You can get to know a company better when things go sideways... I've received my headphones very quickly and I was happy for a few days, but found two things that made me want to return them. There was no return address on the website, just the option of opening a ticket, this took me back at first. I did just that and I was within a day contacted by the support person, given all the details I needed regarding the return address closest to the place I live. I was under the impression that I'll get my money back when the package gets delivered to Anker, but they were kind enough to trust and provided a return before the package reached their return warehouse. For my recent Amazon return I got a refund after 2 weeks... I've recently been through 5 headphones, build quality wise Anker's were truly the best. If it wasn't for the way the ANC worked on a train ride I would gladly keep them over the Bose I ended up with keeping.

I purchased a pair of bluetooth headphones and I love them. They were only $45 and they sound just as good as a high end brand of wired headphones that were $200.They paired quickly and maintain a solid connection. They support pairing to two devices so I have them paired to my computer and TV.I read a review that stated the start up sound hurt their ears. Yes, it is loud. Just don't put them on until they connect! Duh.I would definitely recommend this brand.

Great buying experience and a highly recommend portable speaker.
